headline.main: Seagate Is Said to Get Offer From Private Equity

docs.abstract: Private equity firms TPG and Kohlberg Kravis Roberts are said to have teamed up to make preliminary offer to take over hard drive maker Seagate Technology in what would be largest leveraged buyout of 2010; Seagate's shares rise 21 percent in after-hours trading, giving company market value of $6 billion; photo (M)
docs.snippet: Private equity firms TPG and Kohlberg Kravis Roberts are said to have teamed up to make preliminary offer to take over hard drive maker Seagate Technology in what would be largest leveraged buyout of 2010; Seagate's shares rise 21 percent in...

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED and PETER LATTMAN
